definition: "to eat" or "food" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 184)
sb who is always hungry/glutton/(Buddhism) hungry ghost
like a hungry tiger pouncing on its prey
The well-fed cannot know how the starving suffer (idiom).
pinyin: bao3 han4 bu4 zhi1 e4 han4 ji1

definition: starved corpses fill the roads (idiom); state of famine
fullness for the bold, famine for the timid (idiom)
pinyin: cheng1 si3 dan3 da4 de5 , e4 si3 dan3 xiao3 de5
containing_words.word: 撑死胆大的，饿死胆小的

definition: lit. heaven won't let the sparrows go hungry (idiom)/fig. don't give up hope/if you tough it out, there will be light at the end of the tunnel
pinyin: lao3 tian1 ye2 e4 bu4 si3 xia1 jia1 que4

definition: The well-fed cannot know how the starving suffer (idiom).
pinyin: bao3 ren2 bu4 zhi1 e4 ren2 ji1

sentences.english: It makes you insanely hungry and thirsty.
sentences.chinese: 它让你疯狂的感到饿和渴。

sentences.english: A little rabbit is picking mushrooms in a forest. A wolf is coming. He is very hungry.
sentences.chinese: 一只小兔子正在森林里采蘑菇，一只狼来了，他很饿。

sentences.english: If you get the munchies , eat something that triggers serotonin, which makes you sleepy.
sentences.chinese: 如果你饿了，就吃一些帮助睡眠的食物。

sentences.english: Were they not born, have to eat, get hungry and so on?
sentences.chinese: 难道他们不会饿，不需要食物裹腹？

sentences.english: Sometimes he gets hungry and eats like a glutton.
sentences.chinese: 当他饿的时候，吃起东西来像个老饕。

sentences.english: The hungry marchers shambled slowly along the road.
sentences.chinese: 行军的人饿得步履蹒跚在路上慢慢走着。

sentences.english: The burned scents from ustulate milk and matches make me hungry.
sentences.chinese: 牛奶烧糊了，火柴烧黑了，那焦香我闻见了就觉得饿。

sentences.english: At twelve o'clock I'm very hungry.
The dog was so hungry that he left next to nothing in his food bowl.
sentences.chinese: 那只狗饿得把碗里的食物吃得几乎不剩。

sentences.english: You can't be hungry, you have just had your dinner.
sentences.chinese: 你现在不可能觉得饿，你刚吃过饭。

sentences.english: I"m not a bit hungry but not a little thirsty ."
sentences.chinese: 我一点也不饿，可就是渴得要命。

sentences.english: I'm hungry, and there's a take-out restaurant near here.
sentences.chinese: 我饿了，这附近有一家外卖餐馆。

sentences.english: God I'm hungry. I only had a dingo's breakfast this morning.
sentences.chinese: 天啊，我肚子好饿，我晃了一个早上，都还没吃早餐。

sentences.english: I was so hungry that I wolfed down my meal.
sentences.chinese: 我饿得狼吞虎咽地吃饭。

sentences.english: I'm so hungry that I can stodge a sheep.
sentences.chinese: 我太饿了，现在我能吃掉一只羊。

definition: one can't function properly on an empty stomach (idiom)/an empty sack cannot stand upright
pinyin: ren2 shi4 tie3 fan4 shi4 gang1

definition: to starve to death/to be very hungry
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
sound made by an empty stomach
to gobble up/to gorge oneself on (food)
